markdownRemark.html:
What did I spend my time on today

Today I spent some time catching up on administrative stuff that I’ve put off over the past few weeks. I still worked with some junior coworkers on figuring out how to build their OpenShift clusters and for the most part they were successful. I also spent some time brushing up on my agile project management skills as I have an opportunity to work in that capacity on a project. It’s been awhile since I had to set up a kanban board and wrangle all of the chaos that projects entail, so I’m kind of excited for that.

I spent some time working on seeing how Python can be used for system automation, specifically on the linux sysadmin side. I forgot how fun an easy it is to work in Python. Exploring some of these simple tools has gotten me excited to write software again. Now I’m starting to look for small tools I could potentially write for my daily work life, just to keep my skillset sharp.

frontmatter.title: February 3 Thoughts
frontmatter.description: Just a daily log of my thoughts and what I'm working on today.
